intro: Guatteria elongata, commonly known as the elongated guatteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its elongated, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. Its fruit is a fleshy, berry-like structure that contains several seeds. Guatteria elongata is often found in understory habitats of tropical forests, contributing to the biodiversity of these ecosystems.
